moves.1. e4: This game was played in a Thematic MT hosted by Jongraft.  The initial position starts after 4. Nxd4
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4: I'm sure this game may prove to have errors & missed opportunities for both sides.  However, it was fun to play & has a dramatic ending.
moves.5. Nc3 e5 6. Nf3 Bb4 7. Bc4: I ignore the threat to my e pawn
moves.9. Qd5: Threatens mate at f7 & the hanging Knight.
moves.9... O-O 10. Qxe4 Re8 11. O-O Qa5 12. Bd: Black wants to fork my Queen & Bishop
moves.16... Bf5 17. Qh4:
After Qh4 I saw

17         ...f6
18.Qxf6  Qc7
!9. Bxf5  gxf5
20.Qxf5
moves.17... f6 18. Qxf6 Rd7: Rd7?  I believe this to be Black's key error in the game.
moves.19. Bxf5 gxf5 20. Qxf5: Qe6  is probably better here.  I figured he would play Rf7 & then I could play Qe6.
moves.20... Rf7: Well I guessed right, but 20.Qe6  might have been better.
moves.21. Qe6: Pinning the Rook with the idea of Ng5
moves.21... Nb4:
I was pleased to see this move.  It told me that Black was overconfident in his position & wanted to counter-attack my Queen-side.  Not until analysis did I see 21...Nd4 leading to 

22.Qg4   Kh8
23.Nxd4  Qxd4
24.Qxd4  exd4

The material comes off, I'm up a Bishop & a pawn; but the win is far from clear.
moves.22. Rab1: Pinning his Knight & giving him trouble in hope that he will further commit to the Queen-side attack.
moves.22... Qa5:
It worked.  Now when I play Ng5 & the Queen comes to c7 in defense, I can trade off.  So now my plan is...

Ng5  Qc7
Qxf7   Qxf7
Nxf7   Kxf7
Rxb4

I'll be up a Rook, Bishop, & a pawn.  The win might be several moves away, but it's clear.  I just force trades until I'm the only one who has material left.
moves.23. Ng5: Attacking the pinned Rook as planned.
moves.23... Raf8: At this point alarm bells start ringing in my head.  Black is in trouble.  Both of his Rooks are attacked, 1 of them is pinned.  There might be a mating attack here, but I can't quite see it.
moves.24. Nxf7: I figure I'll take his Rook; let Black re-capture, pinning his other Rook.  Then maybe I can bring one of my Rooks into the attack.
moves.24... Nxc2:
Well I wanted to bring a Rook in, now I can do it with tempo.

Nxd6   Kh8
Rxe5
moves.25. Nxd6+ Kh8 26. Rxe5: I could have played Qxe5 here & forced the trade of Queens, but I didn't want to.  If after Rxe5 Black brought the Queen home, then everything gets traded & I win the Endgame.  Black doesn't want to trade either.  So I figured he would grab my a pawn instead & threaten my back rank.
moves.26... Qxa2: Black threatens mate in 1.  I had to know for certain when I played Rxe5 that Qxa2 wasn't a threat.  In fact, it leads to mate in 2.  Here mate in 2 beats mate in 1.
moves.27. Qf6+:
Qf6 !  There are only 2 possible replies.  27...Kg8 followed by Qg7#.  Or

       ...Rxf6
Re8   Rf8
Rxf8#
moves.27... Rxf6 28. Re8+: Here he resigns.  In this game I got to hold off mate in 1 for 2 moves, & Sacrifice my Queen to force mate.  A pretty ending & a fun game.  Hat's off to Jongraft, he gave me a hard time.
